passage_text: Admission. Each year, 300 students apply for the program, which is 50% more than the average for all physical therapy schools. The program accepts 15% of these applicants, which is 3% lower

Cumulative GPA. A minimum cumulative GPA on all post-high school courses of 3.00, calculated on a 4-point scale, is required of all applicants. The cumulative GPA calculated by PTCAS and listed on the applicant's PTCAS application will serve as the cumulative GPA of record.

Minimum GPA-Most PT programs have minimum grade point average (GPA) requirements. These minimum scores vary by institution and may be low as compared with the average GPA of applicants offered admission. The average overall undergraduate GPA for accepted PTCAS applicants in 2011-12 was 3.52.
